title: Project Planning and Requirements Gathering
description: Update the project scope, objectives, and requirements for the ThreatModelingAutomation system. This should include gathering inputs from key stakeholders (e.g., security experts, software architects, developers) to understand the current threat modeling practices, challenges, and desired features/capabilities of the automated system. Additionally, research existing threat modeling methodologies, tools, and industry best practices to inform the requirements. Consider incorporating a hybrid approach combining machine learning and human expertise for more effective and accurate threat modeling. Also, focus on providing flexible configuration options to cater to diverse threat modeling needs across different domains, while ensuring scalability and maintainability of the system. The hybrid approach should prioritize usability and efficiency, with clear user interfaces for input and output data visualization. Furthermore, document the development process, including milestones, in the RFC to provide a roadmap for the project.

title: Revised System Architecture Design for ThreatModelingAutomation
description: Provide a revised design of the overall architecture for the ThreatModelingAutomation system. The revised design should include components, data flow, integration points, and considerations for scalability, maintainability, security, and separation of concerns between frontend, backend, and database layers. Additionally, ensure proper API design for each layer to facilitate seamless communication and interactions within the system.

title: Threat Modeling Methodology
description: Define the methodology and techniques for automating the threat modeling process. The methodology should be comprehensive, scalable, adaptable to various application architectures and technologies, capable of handling complex systems. Incorporate AI and machine learning techniques where appropriate, focusing on data collection, analysis, and threat identification methods. The methodology should also include a clear explanation of how the system will learn from threats over time, improving its threat prediction capabilities. Ensure that the methodology is well-documented for easy understanding and implementation by developers and other team members. Collaborate with the security specialist to ensure the threat modeling process covers all necessary security aspects.

title: Data Modeling and Database Design
description: Design the data models and database schemas required for storing and managing threat modeling data. The data models should support efficient querying, indexing, scalability to handle large volumes of data. Consider data normalization, integrity constraints, access control mechanisms, and optimize for performance. Align with industry best practices such as the Data Modeling Zone method or the Domain-Driven Design approach, but also consider the NoSQL database solutions like MongoDB or DynamoDB due to their flexibility, scalability, and high performance in handling semi-structured data. Also, ensure that the design is compatible with our existing tech stack and can be easily integrated with other components of the system. The design should be modular, extensible, and maintainable.

title: User Interface Design - Revised
description: Revise the user interface design for the ThreatModelingAutomation system. The updated design should include input forms for detailed system and application information, interactive visualization tools for threat modeling diagrams and data flows, comprehensive reporting features for generating threat reports, mitigation recommendations, and exportable PDF or Excel files. The design should be intuitive, user-friendly, accessible to a wide range of users with varying technical backgrounds. Additionally, consider integrating real-time threat updates, alerts, and feedback mechanisms, as well as ensuring the interface is mobile responsive and adheres to Web Content Accessibility Guidelines (WCAG). Also, add features for user authentication, authorization, and session management.

title: Backend Development
description: Implement the backend components of the ThreatModelingAutomation system, including threat modeling algorithms, data processing, and integration with other systems.

title: Frontend Development
description: Implement the user interface components of the ThreatModelingAutomation system, including input forms, visualization tools, and reporting features.

title: Testing and Quality Assurance
description: Develop and execute test plans for the ThreatModelingAutomation system, including unit tests, integration tests, and user acceptance testing.

title: Deployment and DevOps
description: Set up the deployment infrastructure and automate the deployment process for the ThreatModelingAutomation system.

title: Documentation and Training
description: Create user manuals, technical documentation, and training materials for the ThreatModelingAutomation system.
